definition: to invite a group of people (to assemble for a gathering)
to invite/to request/to intercept/to solicit/to seek
to gather/to collect/collected works/classifier for sections of a TV series etc: episode

sentences.english: People concerned have been called together here to discuss what to do next.
sentences.chinese: 邀集有关人士讨论下一步干什么。

sentences.english: With unerring intuition he brought together a remarkable collection of distinguished persons.
sentences.chinese: 他知人善任，邀集了一大批社会名流。

sentences.english: People concerned have been invited here to discuss what to do next.
sentences.chinese: 邀集有关人士讨论一下下一步干什么。

sentences.english: This year, Mr. Castro plans to invite his colleagues to join the dragon boat competition during the Dragon Boat Festival.
sentences.chinese: 今年，康处长还打算邀集同事组队参加端午龙舟竞赛。

definition: to cooperate on a great undertaking or joint project
to invite/to request/to intercept/to solicit/to seek
variant of 聯袂|联袂[lian2 mei4]
to use as a venue (e.g. use {a restaurant} as the venue {for a farewell party})
to rely on sb for support
to attend a meeting as a nonvoting delegate
to recruit talent/to round up/to enlist the services of sb
member of a board of directors
lit. to open a room/fig. to settle in a quiet room/behind closed doors
